intro: Marginaria karwinskyana, commonly known as the Karwinsky's marginaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Marginaria karwinskyana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
